summaryText: Wow, what a powerful sermon about influence and stewardship! Pastor Travis Hearn delivered an incredible message challenging every believer to recognize and leverage the God-given gifts of influence and affluence. Can you imagine how different our world would be if every Christian truly understood their potential impact? PT reminds us that everyone - absolutely everyone - has influence, whether they realize it or not. From high school students to professional athletes, we all have a 'window' of opportunity to make a difference for God's kingdom. I love how he used the story of Moses and the burning bush to illustrate how God wants us to surrender our 'staff' - our identity, influence, and income - and watch Him transform it into a 'rod of God' capable of supernatural miracles! The most convicting moment? When he challenged us to ask: Are you wasting your window of influence, or are you using it to lead people towards Jesus? Pastor Travis's personal stories about his own journey - from trying to lead people away from Christ in high school to now dedicating his life to Kingdom impact - make this message so relatable and powerful. The challenge is clear: Be a thermostat, not a thermometer. Control the culture's temperature through your influence, don't just reflect it.
mainPoints: Everyone has influence, and God expects us to use it for His kingdom
Surrender your gifts (identity, influence, income) to God to see supernatural transformation
Be a thermostat Christian who changes culture, not a thermometer Christian who merely reflects it

versesMentioned.text: You are the salt of the earth. But if the salt loses its saltiness, how can it be made salty again? It is no longer good for anything, except to be thrown out and trampled underfoot. You are the light of the world. A town built on a hill cannot be hidden. Neither do people light a lamp and put it under a bowl. Instead they put it on its stand, and it gives light to everyone in the house. In the same way, let your light shine before others, that they may see your good deeds and glorify your Father in heaven.
so that you may become blameless and pure, 'children of God without fault in a warped and crooked generation.' Then you will shine among them like stars in the sky.
'Do not come any closer,' God said. 'Take off your sandals, for the place where you are standing is holy ground.'
For whoever wants to save their life will lose it, but whoever loses their life for me will find it.
Consider how far you have fallen! Repent and do the things you did at first. If you do not repent, I will come to you and remove your lampstand from its place.

Monday.scripture: Matthew 5:16: 'In the same way, let your light shine before others, that they may see your good deeds and glorify your Father in heaven.'
Monday.action: Make a list of 3 specific people in your life who need to see Christ's love. Pray about how you can intentionally show God's light to them this week.
Monday.prayer: Lord, open my eyes to the influence opportunities you've placed around me. Help me shine Your light authentically and powerfully today. Give me courage to use my influence for Your kingdom. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: Colossians 3:17: 'And whatever you do, whether in word or deed, do it all in the name of the Lord Jesus, giving thanks to God the Father through him.'
Tuesday.focus: Intentional kingdom impact in everyday interactions
Tuesday.action: Choose one workplace or social interaction today where you will be intentionally kind, encouraging, and Christ-like. Reflect on how your attitude might influence others.
Tuesday.prayer: Father, help me see my daily interactions as opportunities to represent You. Transform my words and actions to reflect Your love and grace. Make me a thermostat, not a thermometer. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: Proverbs 11:25: 'A generous person will prosper; whoever refreshes others will be refreshed.'
Wednesday.focus: Using influence to uplift and encourage others
Wednesday.action: Send an unexpected message of encouragement to someone in your network. Share a specific way they've positively impacted your life.
Wednesday.prayer: God, teach me to use my words to build up, not tear down. Help me see the potential in others and speak life into their circumstances. Make me an agent of Your encouragement. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: 1 Peter 4:10: 'Each of you should use whatever gift you have received to serve others, as faithful stewards of God's grace in its various forms.'
Thursday.action: List three talents or skills God has given you. Brainstorm one practical way you could use each of these gifts to serve your church, community, or someone in need.
Thursday.prayer: Lord, reveal the gifts You've placed in me. Show me creative ways to steward these talents for Your glory. Give me wisdom to use my abilities to serve others. Amen.

Friday.scripture: Ephesians 2:10: 'For we are God's handiwork, created in Christ Jesus to do good works, which God prepared in advance for us to do.'
Friday.action: Reflect on the unique experiences, relationships, and opportunities God has given you. Journal about how these might represent your specific 'window of influence'.
Friday.prayer: Father, help me see my life's journey as a purposeful path You've designed. Give me clarity about the specific ways You want to use me. Align my heart with Your purposes. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: Romans 12:6-8: 'We have different gifts, according to the grace given to each of us. If your gift is prophesying, then prophesy in accordance with your faith; if it is serving, then serve; if it is teaching, then teach; if it is to encourage, then give encouragement; if it is giving, then give generously; if it is to lead, do it diligently; if it is to show mercy, do it cheerfully.'
Saturday.action: Take a spiritual gifts assessment or discuss with a trusted mentor how you might more effectively use your God-given influence and abilities.
Saturday.prayer: God, I surrender my talents, influence, and opportunities to You. Show me how to be a faithful steward of the gifts You've entrusted to me. Use me powerfully for Your kingdom. Amen.
